intro: Galium uncinulatum, commonly known as hooked bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a small, two-valved capsule that releases tiny seeds. Galium uncinulatum is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
